{"text":"This is the context and goal of my project: I want to create an iOS app for people who are owners of new puppies such that we can use AI to establish a routine for the dog and help everyone in the family monitor the puppy's habit and progress

There are two types of users in the app -- 1) the primary owner 2) caretakers. The primary owner are the main admin of the app. They own the login, the initial onboarding and can manage permissions. The caretakers can only contribute to the caretaking of the dog but cannot make any changes to the settings of the dog.

The initial user journey will be as such for primary owner:

1) Fill in the onboarding questionaire
2) Create account to be able to view the results of the questionaire
3) Use AI to determine a routine for the puppy and display it to the user
4) Allow the user to send invite links to up to 1 more caretaker (they just need to copy the invite link, they can send it via third-party messaging platforms themselves, no integrations required here)
5) They can see when the caretaker has accepted the invite
Step 4 and 5 are not blockers to the primary owner being able to use the app to view the dog's routine and track the puppy's progress

I will create the screens for caretaker flow in another file"}

{"text":"I'll help you create this puppy care management app! This is an exciting project that will help new puppy owners establish healthy routines.

Since your app requires **user authentication, multi-user data sharing (between owners and caretakers), an invitation system, and persistent data storage**, you'll need a backend to make this work properly. 

**Supabase would be perfect for your use case** because it provides:
- User authentication for primary owners and caretakers
- A database to store dog profiles, routines, and progress tracking
- Real-time capabilities so caretakers can see updates immediately
- A way to manage invitations and permissions

Please note that Figma Make is not designed for collecting PII (personally identifiable information) or securing highly sensitive data. For a production app handling user accounts and personal information, you'll want to review Supabase's security best practices.

Would you like to connect to Supabase to enable these features?","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"The user wants to create an iOS app for new puppy owners with the following features:

1. Two user types: primary owner and caretakers
2. Primary owner journey:
   - Onboarding questionnaire
   - Account creation to view results
   - AI-generated routine for puppy
   - Send invite links to caretakers
   - See when caretakers accept invites
   - View dog's routine and track progress

This is clearly a SupabaseRequired use case because:
- Multi-user authentication (primary owner and caretakers)
- Data persistence (dog profiles, routines, progress tracking)
- Invitation system requiring backend
- Shared data between users

I should:
1. Ask the user if they'd like to connect to Supabase
2. Explain why it's needed
3. Use the supabase_connect tool

Wait, let me re-read the instructions. The user mentioned "iOS app" but this is Figma Make which creates web applications. I should proceed with creating a web application that could work on iOS devices (mobile-responsive).

Classification: SupabaseRequired - this explicitly needs backend functionality for:
- User authentication
- Multi-user data sharing
- Invitation system
- Persistent data storage

I should ask about Supabase connection first before implementing anything.","signature":""}

{"text":"I'll create a frontend-only version of the primary owner flow for your puppy care app. This will include the onboarding questionnaire, a simulated AI routine generation, and the invite system UI. The data will be stored locally in the browser for now.\n\nLet me start by implementing the main components and flow:","textMode":"visible_message"}
{"text":"Now let me create the components for the primary owner flow:","textMode":"visible_message"}

Onboarding questionnaire about the puppy\\n2. Account creation (simulated with local storage)\\n3. AI-generated routine display\\n4. Invite system for caretakers\\n5. Dashboard to track progress\\n\\nI'll create these components:\\n- OnboardingQuestionnaire.tsx - collects puppy info\\n- CreateAccount.tsx - simple account creation form\\n- RoutineDisplay.tsx - shows the AI-generated routine\\n- InviteCaretakers.tsx - allows inviting caretakers\\n- Dashboard.tsx - main view for tracking progress\\n- App.tsx - orchestrates the flow\\n\\nFor the iOS mobile feel, I'll make it mobile-first and responsive.\\n\"}"}

{"toolCallId":"toolu_01XJ4gr8AF1dTxJy2bEZMGLR","toolName":"write_tool","argsJson":"{\"path\":\"/src/app/components/AIRoutineGenerator.tsx\",\"file_text\":\"import { useEffect, useState } from \\\"react\\\";\\nimport { Card, CardContent, CardDescription, CardHeader, CardTitle } from \\\"./ui/card\\\";\\nimport { Progress } from \\\"./ui/progress\\\";\\nimport { Loader2 } from \\\"lucide-react\\\";\\n\\ninterface QuestionnaireData {\\n puppyName: string;\\n breed: string;\\n age: string;\\n weight: string;\\n energyLevel: string;\\n houseTrainingStatus: string;\\n sleepLocation: string;\\n dietType: string;\\n behaviorConcerns: string;\\n goals: string;\\n}\\n\\ninterface AIRoutineGeneratorProps {\\n questionnaireData: QuestionnaireData;\\n onComplete: (routine: any) => void;\\n}\\n\\nexport function AIRoutineGenerator({ questionnaireData, onComplete }: AIRoutineGeneratorProps) {\\n const [progress, setProgress] = useState(0);\\n const [status, setStatus] = useState(\\\"Analyzing puppy profile...\\\");\\n\\n useEffect(() => {\\n const steps = [\\n { progress: 20, status: \\\"Analyzing puppy profile...\\\", delay: 800 },\\n { progress: 40, status: \\\"Creating feeding schedule...\\\", delay: 1000 },\\n { progress: 60, status: \\\"Planning training activities...\\\", delay: 900 },\\n { progress: 80, status: \\\"Optimizing sleep routine...\\\", delay: 800 },\\n { progress: 100, status: \\\"Finalizing personalized routine...\\\", delay: 700 },\\n ];\\n\\n let currentStep = 0;\\n const interval = setInterval(() => {\\n if (currentStep < steps.length) {\\n setProgress(steps[currentStep].progress);\\n setStatus(steps[currentStep].status);\\n \\n if (currentStep === steps.length - 1) {\\n setTimeout(() => {\\n const routine = generateRoutine(questionnaireData);\\n onComplete(routine);\\n }, steps[currentStep].delay);\\n }\\n \\n currentStep++;\\n } else {\\n clearInterval(interval);\\n }\\n }, 1000);\\n\\n return () => clearInterval(interval);\\n }, [questionnaireData, onComplete]);\\n\\n return (\\n
\\n \\n \\n \\n \\n Generating Routine with AI\\n \\n \\n Creating a personalized routine for {questionnaireData.puppyName}\\n \\n \\n \\n \\n

{status}

\\n );\\n}\\n\\nfunction generateRoutine(data: QuestionnaireData) {\\n const ageInWeeks = parseInt(data.age);\\n const isYoungPuppy = ageInWeeks < 12;\\n \\n // Calculate feeding times based on age\\n const feedingTimes = isYoungPuppy \\n ? [\\\"7:00 AM\\\", \\\"11:00 AM\\\", \\\"3:00 PM\\\", \\\"7:00 PM\\\"]\\n : [\\\"7:00 AM\\\", \\\"12:00 PM\\\", \\\"6:00 PM\\\"];\\n\\n // Calculate potty break frequency\\n const pottyBreakInterval = isYoungPuppy ? \\\"Every 2 hours\\\" : \\\"Every 3-4 hours\\\";\\n\\n // Exercise duration based on energy level\\n const exerciseDuration = {\\n low: \\\"15-20 minutes\\\",\\n medium: \\\"30-40 minutes\\\",\\n high: \\\"45-60 minutes\\\"\\n }[data.energyLevel] || \\\"30 minutes\\\";\\n\\n return {\\n dailySchedule: [\\n {\\n time: \\\"6:30 AM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Wake up & Potty Break\\\",\\n description: \\\"First thing in the morning, take outside for potty break\\\",\\n category: \\\"potty\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: feedingTimes[0],\\n activity: \\\"Breakfast\\\",\\n description: `Feed ${data.dietType.replace(\\\"-\\\", \\\" \\\")}`,\\n category: \\\"feeding\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"7:30 AM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Post-meal Potty Break\\\",\\n description: \\\"Take outside 15-30 minutes after eating\\\",\\n category: \\\"potty\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"8:00 AM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Morning Training Session\\\",\\n description: \\\"5-10 minutes of basic commands (sit, stay, come)\\\",\\n category: \\\"training\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"9:00 AM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Playtime\\\",\\n description: `${exerciseDuration} of active play`,\\n category: \\\"play\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"10:00 AM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Nap Time\\\",\\n description: \\\"Quiet time in crate or designated area\\\",\\n category: \\\"rest\\\"\\n },\\n ...(isYoungPuppy ? [{\\n time: feedingTimes[1],\\n activity: \\\"Lunch\\\",\\n description: `Feed ${data.dietType.replace(\\\"-\\\", \\\" \\\")}`,\\n category: \\\"feeding\\\"\\n }] : []),\\n {\\n time: \\\"12:30 PM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Midday Potty & Walk\\\",\\n description: \\\"Short walk around the block\\\",\\n category: \\\"exercise\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"1:00 PM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Afternoon Nap\\\",\\n description: \\\"Rest time for growing puppy\\\",\\n category: \\\"rest\\\"\\n },\\n ...(isYoungPuppy ? [{\\n time: feedingTimes[2],\\n activity: \\\"Afternoon Snack\\\",\\n description: `Feed ${data.dietType.replace(\\\"-\\\", \\\" \\\")}`,\\n category: \\\"feeding\\\"\\n }] : []),\\n {\\n time: \\\"4:00 PM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Training & Socialization\\\",\\n description: \\\"Practice commands and expose to new experiences\\\",\\n category: \\\"training\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"5:30 PM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Evening Exercise\\\",\\n description: `${exerciseDuration} of play or walk`,\\n category: \\\"exercise\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: feedingTimes[isYoungPuppy ? 3 : 2],\\n activity: \\\"Dinner\\\",\\n description: `Feed ${data.dietType.replace(\\\"-\\\", \\\" \\\")}`,\\n category: \\\"feeding\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"7:30 PM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Post-dinner Potty\\\",\\n description: \\\"Take outside after meal\\\",\\n category: \\\"potty\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"8:00 PM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Calm Evening Time\\\",\\n description: \\\"Quiet bonding time, gentle play\\\",\\n category: \\\"bonding\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"9:30 PM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Final Potty Break\\\",\\n description: \\\"Last chance before bedtime\\\",\\n category: \\\"potty\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: \\\"10:00 PM\\\",\\n activity: \\\"Bedtime\\\",\\n description: `Sleep in ${data.sleepLocation.replace(\\\"-\\\", \\\" \\\")}`,\\n category: \\\"rest\\\"\\n }\\n ],\\n tips: [\\n `${data.puppyName} is ${ageInWeeks} weeks old, so consistency is key!`,\\n `Take ${data.puppyName} outside ${pottyBreakInterval.toLowerCase()} for house training`,\\n `${data.energyLevel.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + data.energyLevel.slice(1)} energy puppies need ${exerciseDuration} of exercise daily`,\\n data.behaviorConcerns ? `Focus on addressing: ${data.behaviorConcerns}` : \\\"Keep training sessions short (5-10 minutes) and positive\\\",\\n \\\"Always supervise interactions with children and other pets\\\",\\n ],\\n trainingGoals: data.goals || \\\"Basic obedience and house training\\\",\\n puppyProfile: {\\n name: data.puppyName,\\n breed: data.breed,\\n age: `${ageInWeeks} weeks`,\\n weight: `${data.weight} lbs`,\\n energyLevel: data.energyLevel\\n }\\n };\\n}\\n\"}"}

string;\\n}\\n\\ninterface AccountData {\\n  name: string;\\n  email: string;\\n  password: string;\\n}\\n\\nexport default function App() {\\n  const [appState, setAppState] = useState<AppState>(\\\"questionnaire\\\");\\n  const [questionnaireData, setQuestionnaireData] = useState<QuestionnaireData | null>(null);\\n  const [accountData, setAccountData] = useState<AccountData | null>(null);\\n  const [routine, setRoutine] = useState<any>(null);\\n\\n  const handleQuestionnaireComplete = (data: QuestionnaireData) => {\\n    setQuestionnaireData(data);\\n    setAppState(\\\"create-account\\\");\\n  };\\n\\n  const handleAccountCreated = (data: AccountData) => {\\n    setAccountData(data);\\n    // Save to local storage for demo purposes\\n    localStorage.setItem(\\\"puppyAppUser\\\", JSON.stringify({\\n      account: data,\\n      puppy: questionnaireData\\n    }));\\n    setAppState(\\\"generating-routine\\\");\\n  };\\n\\n  const handleRoutineGenerated = (generatedRoutine: any) => {\\n    setRoutine(generatedRoutine);\\n    // Save routine to local storage\\n    localStorage.setItem(\\\"puppyRoutine\\\", JSON.stringify(generatedRoutine));\\n    setAppState(\\\"dashboard\\\");\\n  };\\n\\n  return (\\n    <>\\n      {appState === \\\"questionnaire\\\" && (\\n        <OnboardingQuestionnaire onComplete={handleQuestionnaireComplete} />\\n      )}\\n\\n      {appState === \\\"create-account\\\" && questionnaireData && (\\n        <CreateAccount\\n          puppyName={questionnaireData.puppyName}\\n          onComplete={handleAccountCreated}\\n        />\\n      )}\\n\\n      {appState === \\\"generating-routine\\\" && questionnaireData && (\\n        <AIRoutineGenerator\\n          questionnaireData={questionnaireData}\\n          onComplete={handleRoutineGenerated}\\n        />\\n      )}\\n\\n      {appState === \\\"dashboard\\\" && routine && accountData && questionnaireData && (\\n        <Dashboard\\n          routine={routine}\\n          accountData={accountData}\\n          puppyName={questionnaireData.puppyName}\\n        />\\n      )}\\n\\n      <Toaster />\\n    </>\\n  );\\n}\\n\"}"}

{"text":"Perfect! I've created a complete puppy care management app with the primary owner flow. The app guides users through:

1. **Onboarding Questionnaire** - A 5-step form collecting puppy details (name, breed, age, energy level, training status, diet, etc.)
2. **Account Creation** - Simple signup form to save the profile
3. **AI Routine Generator** - Animated loading screen that simulates AI analysis and generates a personalized daily schedule
4. **Dashboard** - Main interface with three tabs:
   - **Schedule**: Complete daily routine with checkable activities
   - **Team**: Invite system for adding up to 1 caretaker with copy-to-clipboard functionality
   - **Insights**: Progress tracking, weekly stats, and puppy profile

The app is mobile-first and responsive for iOS devices, uses local storage for data persistence, and includes toast notifications for user feedback. The routine is intelligently generated based on the puppy's age, energy level, and other factors provided in the questionnaire.","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"Update the prototype based on my user journey here: 

# PupPlan - User Flows

## Flow 1: Primary Owner - First Time Setup

### Step 1: App Launch & Authentication
```
Screen: Welcome Screen
- App logo + tagline: "A smarter routine for your new puppy"
- [Sign in with Apple] (native Apple authentication button)
  -> Triggers native Apple Sign-In / Create Account flow
  -> If user has an existing PupPlan account: sign in and route to
     main app (daily routine view)
  -> If user is new (no existing account): create account and route
     to onboarding questionnaire (Step 2)
- All users are treated as primary owners by default unless they
  have accepted an invite link from another primary owner
- Terms of Service + Privacy Policy links at bottom
```

### Step 2: Onboarding Questionnaire (New Primary Owners Only)
```
Screen: Questionnaire (multi-step, 4 screens)
- Progress bar at the top of each screen showing completion
  (e.g., filled segments: ‚ñà‚ñà‚ñë‚ñë 1 of 4)
- Progress bar persists across all steps so the user can
  estimate how long the onboarding will take

Step 1/4 - "Tell us about your puppy"
  - Puppy's name (text input, required)
  - Breed (searchable dropdown, required, includes "Mixed/Unknown")
  - Upload a photo (optional, camera or photo library)

Step 2/4 - "How old is your puppy?"
  - Months (integer input field, required)
  - Weeks (integer input field, required)
    Note: Both fields displayed together. User enters e.g.
    Months: 3, Weeks: 2 for a puppy that is 3 months and 2 weeks old.
    Input restricted to integers only (no decimals, no text).
    Validation: months >= 0, weeks >= 0, total age must be > 0.
  - Current weight (lbs or kg toggle)

Step 3/4 - "Where does your puppy live?"
  - Living situation (single select):
    [ ] Apartment
    [ ] House with yard
    [ ] House without yard

Step 4/4 - "Tell us about your schedule"
  - Typical work arrangement (single select):
    [ ] Work from home
    [ ] Office/hybrid (specify days in office)
    [ ] Shift work (specify typical hours)
    [ ] Stay at home / retired
  - What time do you usually wake up? (time picker)
  - What time do you usually go to bed? (time picker)

-> CTA: "Generate My Puppy's Routine"
```

### Step 4: AI Routine Generation
```
Screen: Generation Loading
- Animated puppy illustration
- Rotating messages:
  "Analyzing [Puppy Name]'s breed characteristics..."
  "Calculating age-appropriate exercise needs..."
  "Building a personalized daily routine..."
  "Almost ready!"
- Progress bar (cosmetic, ~8-10 seconds)

-> Auto-transition to routine view on completion
```

### Step 5: Routine Reveal
```
Screen: Your Puppy's Routine (Main Screen)
- Header: "[Puppy Name]'s Day" + today's date
- Celebration moment: "Your routine is ready!" (dismiss after 3 sec or tap)
- Timeline view showing all activities for the day
- Floating tooltip: "Tap any activity to mark it done" (first-time only)
- Bottom tab: option to view Progress or Settings
```"}

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building an iOS app for new puppy owners that uses AI to establish routines and helps families monitor their puppy's habits and progress. The app has two user types: primary owners (who are admins with full permissions) and caretakers (who can only contribute to caregiving but can't change settings). The primary owner flow includes: 1) filling out an onboarding questionnaire about their puppy, 2) creating an account to view results, 3) using AI to generate a personalized routine, 4) inviting up to 1 caretaker via shareable links, and 5) seeing when caretakers accept invites. The app should be mobile-first and responsive for iOS devices, and steps 4-5 shouldn't block the primary owner from using the core functionality.

## Current state
I've implemented the complete primary owner flow with components for the onboarding questionnaire (`OnboardingQuestionnaire.tsx`), account creation (`CreateAccount.tsx`), AI routine generation (`AIRoutineGenerator.tsx`), and the main dashboard (`Dashboard.tsx`) with schedule tracking, team management, and progress insights. The app uses local storage for data persistence and includes a working invite system with copy-to-clipboard functionality for caretaker invitations.

[{\\n time: feedingTimes[1],\\n activity: \\\"Lunch\\\",\\n description: \\\"Midday meal\\\",\\n category: \\\"feeding\\\"\\n }] : []),\\n {\\n time: formatTime(wakeHour + 5.5, 30),\\n activity: \\\"Midday Potty & Walk\\\",\\n description: \\\"Short walk around the block\\\",\\n category: \\\"exercise\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: formatTime(wakeHour + 6, 0),\\n activity: \\\"Afternoon Nap\\\",\\n description: \\\"Rest time for growing puppy\\\",\\n category: \\\"rest\\\"\\n },\\n ...(isYoungPuppy ? [{\\n time: feedingTimes[2],\\n activity: \\\"Afternoon Snack\\\",\\n description: \\\"Light meal\\\",\\n category: \\\"feeding\\\"\\n }] : []),\\n {\\n time: formatTime(bedHour - 6, 0),\\n activity: \\\"Training & Socialization\\\",\\n description: \\\"Practice commands and expose to new experiences\\\",\\n category: \\\"training\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: formatTime(bedHour - 4.5, 30),\\n activity: \\\"Evening Exercise\\\",\\n description: `${exerciseDuration} of play or walk`,\\n category: \\\"exercise\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: feedingTimes[isYoungPuppy ? 3 : 2],\\n activity: \\\"Dinner\\\",\\n description: \\\"Evening meal\\\",\\n category: \\\"feeding\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: formatTime(bedHour - 2.5, 30),\\n activity: \\\"Post-dinner Potty\\\",\\n description: \\\"Take outside after meal\\\",\\n category: \\\"potty\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: formatTime(bedHour - 2, 0),\\n activity: \\\"Calm Evening Time\\\",\\n description: \\\"Quiet bonding time, gentle play\\\",\\n category: \\\"bonding\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: formatTime(bedHour - 0.5, 30),\\n activity: \\\"Final Potty Break\\\",\\n description: \\\"Last chance before bedtime\\\",\\n category: \\\"potty\\\"\\n },\\n {\\n time: formatTime(bedHour, 0),\\n activity: \\\"Bedtime\\\",\\n description: \\\"Sleep time in designated area\\\",\\n category: \\\"rest\\\"\\n }\\n ],\\n tips: [\\n `${data.puppyName} is ${data.ageMonths} months and ${data.ageWeeks} weeks old - consistency is key!`,\\n `Take ${data.puppyName} outside ${pottyBreakInterval.toLowerCase()} for house training`,\\n `${isYoungPuppy ? 'Young' : 'Growing'} puppies need ${exerciseDuration} of exercise daily`,\\n hasYard ? \\\"Take advantage of your yard for quick potty breaks and play sessions\\\" : \\\"Regular walks are important for socialization and exercise\\\",\\n data.workArrangement === \\\"work-from-home\\\" \\n ? \\\"Working from home? Use breaks to interact with your puppy\\\" \\n : \\\"Consider a midday dog walker if you're away during the day\\\",\\n ],\\n puppyProfile: {\\n name: data.puppyName,\\n breed: data.breed,\\n photoUrl: data.photoUrl,\\n age: `${data.ageMonths} months, ${data.ageWeeks} weeks`,\\n weight: `${data.weight} ${data.weightUnit}`,\\n livingSituation: data.livingSituation.replace(/-/g, \\\" \\\"),\\n workArrangement: data.workArrangement.replace(/-/g, \\\" \\\")\\n }\\n };\\n}\\n\\nfunction formatTime(hours: number, minutes: number): string {\\n let h = Math.floor(hours);\\n let m = minutes;\\n \\n // Handle overflow\\n if (h >= 24) h = h % 24;\\n if (h < 0) h = 24 + h;\\n \\n return `${h.toString().padStart(2, \\\"0\\\")}:${m.toString().padStart(2, \\\"0\\\")}`;\\n}\\n\"}"}

load their data and go to dashboard\\n      const savedData = JSON.parse(hasExistingAccount);\\n      setQuestionnaireData(savedData.puppy);\\n      const savedRoutine = localStorage.getItem(\\\"puppyRoutine\\\");\\n      if (savedRoutine) {\\n        setRoutine(JSON.parse(savedRoutine));\\n        setAppState(\\\"dashboard\\\");\\n      } else {\\n        // Data exists but no routine, regenerate\\n        setAppState(\\\"generating-routine\\\");\\n      }\\n    } else {\\n      // New user - show onboarding\\n      setAppState(\\\"questionnaire\\\");\\n    }\\n  };\\n\\n  const handleQuestionnaireComplete = (data: QuestionnaireData) => {\\n    setQuestionnaireData(data);\\n    // Save to local storage\\n    localStorage.setItem(\\\"puppyAppUser\\\", JSON.stringify({\\n      account: mockAccountData,\\n      puppy: data\\n    }));\\n    setAppState(\\\"generating-routine\\\");\\n  };\\n\\n  const handleRoutineGenerated = (generatedRoutine: any) => {\\n    setRoutine(generatedRoutine);\\n    // Save routine to local storage\\n    localStorage.setItem(\\\"puppyRoutine\\\", JSON.stringify(generatedRoutine));\\n    setAppState(\\\"dashboard\\\");\\n  };\\n\\n  return (\\n    <>\\n      {appState === \\\"welcome\\\" && (\\n        <WelcomeScreen onSignIn={handleSignIn} />\\n      )}\\n\\n      {appState === \\\"questionnaire\\\" && (\\n        <OnboardingQuestionnaire onComplete={handleQuestionnaireComplete} />\\n      )}\\n\\n      {appState === \\\"generating-routine\\\" && questionnaireData && (\\n        <AIRoutineGenerator\\n          questionnaireData={questionnaireData}\\n          onComplete={handleRoutineGenerated}\\n        />\\n      )}\\n\\n      {appState === \\\"dashboard\\\" && routine && questionnaireData && (\\n        <Dashboard\\n          routine={routine}\\n          accountData={mockAccountData}\\n          puppyName={questionnaireData.puppyName}\\n          isFirstTime={!localStorage.getItem(\\\"hasSeenReveal\\\")}\\n        />\\n      )}\\n\\n      <Toaster />\\n    </>\\n  );\\n}\\n\"}"}

{"text":"Perfect! I've successfully updated the PupPlan app to match your detailed user journey. Here's what was implemented:

**Key Updates:**
1. **Welcome Screen** - Beautiful landing page with Apple Sign-In button, app branding ("PupPlan"), and Terms/Privacy links
2. **Revised Questionnaire** - Now 4 streamlined steps with visual progress bars:
   - Step 1: Puppy name, breed (searchable dropdown), optional photo upload
   - Step 2: Age (separate months/weeks fields), weight with unit toggle
   - Step 3: Living situation (apartment/house options)
   - Step 4: Work schedule and daily wake/bed times
3. **AI Generation Screen** - 8-second animated loading with rotating contextual messages
4. **Routine Reveal** - Celebration modal that auto-dismisses after 3 seconds
5. **Dashboard** - Updated header to "{Puppy's} Day" with first-time tooltip showing "Tap any activity to mark it done"
6. **Smart Flow** - Returning users skip onboarding and go straight to their dashboard

The app is mobile-optimized for iOS, uses local storage for persistence, and includes all the delightful micro-interactions you specified. Ready to help puppy owners establish great routines! üê∂","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"Redesign this app to feel like a premium, warm consumer iOS app for new puppy owners ‚Äî not a SaaS dashboard. Apply these changes across all screens:

LAYOUT: Constrain all screens to a mobile phone frame (390px wide). Add safe area padding: 48px top, 34px bottom. Use 20px horizontal padding on all screens.

COLOR PALETTE: Replace the default neutral palette with a warm, friendly scheme. Background: #FFF9F5 (warm off-white). Primary accent: #E8722A (warm orange). Secondary accent: #4A9B7F (sage green for success/completed states). Text primary: #2D1B0E (warm dark brown, not black). Text secondary: #8B7355 (warm gray-brown). Error/missed: #D4574E (soft red). Card backgrounds: #FFFFFF with a subtle warm shadow (0 2px 8px rgba(45,27,14,0.06)).

WELCOME SCREEN: Center the puppy illustration in the top 50% of the screen. Below it, show the app name "PupPlan" in 32px bold and a tagline "A smarter routine for your new puppy" in 16px secondary text color. Place the Sign in with Apple button at the bottom third ‚Äî use Apple's official black capsule button style (full width minus padding, 50px height, 12px border radius, SF Pro Rounded "Sign in with Apple" label in white). Add Terms and Privacy links in 12px muted text below the button.

ONBOARDING QUESTIONNAIRE: Add a segmented progress bar at the top (4 segments, filled segments use the primary orange, unfilled use #E8E0D8). One step per screen. Space form fields 20px apart. Use 14px labels above each input field in secondary text color. Input fields should be 48px tall with 16px border radius and a 1px #E8E0D8 border. The "Next" button at the bottom should be full-width, 50px tall, primary orange background with white text. Add a back arrow in the top left for steps 2-4.

AI GENERATION SCREEN: Full-screen warm gradient background (from #FFF9F5 to #FFECD2). Center a large animated puppy illustration. Below it, show rotating text messages in 18px medium weight: "Analyzing [Puppy Name]'s breed..." then "Building a personalized routine..." then "Almost ready!" Add a thin horizontal progress bar below the text (primary orange fill, 4px tall, rounded).

DASHBOARD (DAILY ROUTINE): Header shows "[Puppy Name]'s Day" in 24px bold with today's date in 14px secondary text below. The routine is a vertical timeline. Each activity row is a card (white background, 12px border radius, 16px internal padding, minimum 64px tall). The CURRENT activity card has a 2px left border in primary orange and a light orange background tint (#FFF3EB). COMPLETED activities have a green checkmark icon and muted text (opacity 0.6). MISSED activities have the soft red left border. UPCOMING activities are default white. Show time on the left (14px bold), activity name (16px medium), and a one-line description (13px secondary color). Add 12px vertical gap between activity cards.

TYPOGRAPHY: Use the system San Francisco font throughout. Headings: SF Pro Display. Body: SF Pro Text. Increase base body text to 16px. Guidance notes on activities should be 14px with 1.5 line height."}

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building an iOS app called "PupPlan" for new puppy owners that uses AI to establish routines and helps families monitor their puppy's habits and progress. The app has two user types: primary owners (who are admins with full permissions) and caretakers (who can only contribute to caregiving but can't change settings). The primary owner flow includes: 1) Apple Sign-In authentication on a welcome screen, 2) a 4-step onboarding questionnaire about their puppy (name, breed, age, living situation, and schedule), 3) AI routine generation with animated loading, 4) a celebration reveal screen, and 5) the main dashboard showing the puppy's daily routine. The app should be mobile-first and responsive for iOS devices, with the ability to invite up to 1 caretaker via shareable links without blocking core functionality.

## Current state
I've implemented the complete updated user journey with the new welcome screen (`WelcomeScreen.tsx`), revised 4-step questionnaire (`OnboardingQuestionnaire.tsx`), AI generation screen (`AIRoutineGenerator.tsx`), celebration reveal (`RoutineReveal.tsx`), and updated dashboard (`Dashboard.tsx`) with the "{Puppy's} Day" header format. The app uses local storage for data persistence and includes smart flow logic that routes returning users directly to their dashboard while new users go through the full onboarding experience.

   - Primary: #E8722A (orange)
   - Secondary: #4A9B7F (sage green)
   - Text primary: #2D1B0E
   - Text secondary: #8B7355
   - Error: #D4574E
   - Cards: #FFFFFF with warm shadow
3. Update all screens with these specific design requirements
4. Use SF Pro font family
5. Make it feel premium and warm

I'll need to:
1. Update theme.css with the new color palette
2. Redesign WelcomeScreen
3. Redesign OnboardingQuestionnaire
4. Redesign AIRoutineGenerator
5. Redesign Dashboard
6. Update any other components as needed

Let me start by updating the theme and then each component.","signature":""}

**üè† Welcome Screen:**

- 32px gap between tagline and Sign in button for better visual flow

**üìù Onboarding Radio Cards:**
- Selected cards get orange tint background (rgba(232, 114, 42, 0.08)) with 1.5px orange border
- Unselected cards maintain light gray border
- Hover state adds subtle orange tint (rgba(232, 114, 42, 0.04))
- Smooth transitions between all states

**üìä Dashboard Header:**

- Title centered with proper alignment

- Date moved directly below title within header

**üé® Activity Categories:**

{"text":"the options on this page is broken, I need multiple clicks to select on them"}

{"text":"I can see the issue! The div wrapper has hover and visual states but isn't actually triggering the radio selection when clicked. The radio button only responds when you click directly on the small radio circle or the label text.

To fix this within just the selected div, I need to add an onClick handler. However, this requires using the `updateField` function which is defined outside this element.

**Would you like me to:**
Add a click handler to this div (and the other radio option divs on this page) so clicking anywhere on the card selects that option? This will make the entire card clickable, not just the radio button and label.

This change will need to reference the form update function that's defined earlier in the component.","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"The user is saying that the radio options are broken and require multiple clicks to select. Looking at the selected code, I can see the issue:

The div wrapper has cursor-pointer and hover states, but it's not actually clickable. The RadioGroupItem inside is the actual interactive element, but the div is not wired up to trigger it.

The problem is that clicking on the div doesn't trigger the radio button selection. Only clicking directly on the RadioGroupItem or the Label works. The div should have an onClick handler that triggers the radio selection.

However, the user is asking me to ONLY modify the selected element (the div on line 323). The fix would involve:
1. Adding an onClick handler to the div
2. That handler needs to call the onValueChange function with "apartment"

But wait - I only have the div element selected. The onValueChange function is part of the RadioGroup component which is the parent. So to properly fix this, I would need to:
- Either add onClick to the div that programmatically clicks the radio button
- Or restructure how this works

Actually, looking more carefully - the Label has htmlFor="apartment" which should make clicking the label trigger the radio button. But the div itself is not connected to anything.

The simplest fix within just this div element would be to add an onClick handler that programmatically triggers a click on the radio button input. But that's a bit hacky.

Actually, I think the real issue is that the RadioGroupItem is being obscured or the click events aren't propagating properly. Let me think...

The div has padding and the RadioGroupItem is inside. When you click on the div background (not on the RadioGroupItem or Label), nothing happens. 

The fix within just this div would be to add:
```jsx
onClick={() => updateField("livingSituation", "apartment")}
```

But that requires access to the updateField function which is outside the selected element.

Hmm, let me reconsider. The user selected just the div element. I need to either:


1. Fix it within just that div (which would require duplicating the onClick logic)
2. Explain that I need to modify the parent RadioGroup or access the updateField function

Actually, I can add the onClick directly to the div since the value and updateField are already accessible in scope. The solution is to attach an onClick handler to the div that calls updateField with the appropriate value, since those variables are available in the current scope.","signature":""}

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building an iOS app called "PupPlan" for new puppy owners that uses AI to establish routines and helps families monitor their puppy's habits and progress. The app has two user types: primary owners (who are admins with full permissions) and caretakers (who can only contribute to caregiving but can't change settings). The primary owner flow includes: 1) Apple Sign-In authentication on a welcome screen, 2) a 4-step onboarding questionnaire about their puppy (name, breed, age, living situation, and schedule), 3) AI routine generation with animated loading, 4) a celebration reveal screen, and 5) the main dashboard showing the puppy's daily routine. I've redesigned the entire app with a premium, warm iOS aesthetic using a warm color palette (#FFF9F5 background, #E8722A primary orange, #4A9B7F sage green), proper mobile constraints (390px wide with iOS safe areas), improved typography (SF Pro fonts, 16px buttons with 600 weight), enhanced button states (hover effects, solid disabled colors), radio card selection states (orange tint when selected), and a dashboard with timeline view featuring category dots and a proper header with puppy emoji and settings icon.

## Current state
The app has been completely redesigned with the warm aesthetic and all screens are working properly, but there's a bug in the onboarding questionnaire where the radio option cards require multiple clicks to select because only the small radio button and label text are clickable, not the entire card area. I need to add onClick handlers to make the full card divs clickable for better user experience.

{"text":"To access the dashboard, you need to complete the onboarding flow:

## For New Users (First Time):
1. **Click "Continue with Apple"** on the Welcome screen
2. **Complete the 4-step questionnaire** about your puppy:
   - Step 1: Puppy's name, breed, and photo
   - Step 2: Age and weight
   - Step 3: Living situation (apartment, house with/without yard)
   - Step 4: Work arrangement and schedule
3. **Watch the AI generate the routine** (animated loading screen)
4. **See the celebration reveal** with confetti
5. **Dashboard appears** with your puppy's daily routine timeline

## For Returning Users:
- Click "Continue with Apple" and you'll be taken **directly to the dashboard** (your data is saved in localStorage)

## Quick Test:
If you want to quickly see the dashboard without going through all steps, you can:
1. Complete the onboarding once 
2. Your data will be saved
3. Refresh the page and click "Continue with Apple" - you'll go straight to the dashboard

The app remembers your puppy's profile and routine, so returning users skip straight to the main experience! üê∂

Would you like me to add a skip option for testing, or modify the flow in any way?","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"The user is asking how to access the dashboard. Let me check the current flow:

1. The app starts at "welcome" state
2. When you sign in, it checks localStorage for "puppyAppUser"
3. If there's no existing account, it goes to "questionnaire"
4. After questionnaire, it goes to "generating-routine"
5. After routine generation, it goes to "dashboard"

So to access the dashboard, the user needs to:
1. Click "Continue with Apple" on the welcome screen
2. Complete the 4-step onboarding questionnaire
3. Wait for the AI routine generation (with the animated loading and celebration reveal)
4. Then they'll see the dashboard

For returning users, if they've already completed onboarding, clicking "Continue with Apple" should take them directly to the dashboard.

{"text":"Perfect! I've successfully restored the complete dashboard with activity tracking and stats features. Here's what was implemented:

## ‚ú® Restored Dashboard Features:

**üìä Stats Overview Card** (shows above timeline):
- **Today's Progress** - Large counter showing completed/total activities
- **Circular Progress Indicator** - Visual percentage with animated orange ring
- **Completion Breakdown** - Shows activities completed by primary owner vs caretaker
  - Primary Owner row with orange user icon
  - Caretaker row with sage green users icon (appears when caretaker completes activities)

**üë• User Role Switcher**:
- Toggle between "Owner" and "Caretaker" modes to test the tracking feature
- Owner button (orange when active)
- Caretaker button (sage green when active)
- Completion attribution changes based on who's signed in

**üìà Activity Tracking**:
- Each completed activity is tracked with who completed it and when
- Stats update in real-time as activities are marked complete
- Separate counters for owner vs caretaker completions
- Progress percentage calculation

**üé® Design Consistency**:
- Warm iOS aesthetic throughout
- Card-based layout with soft shadows
- Smooth animations on progress ring
- Proper spacing and hierarchy

Now when you complete the onboarding and reach the dashboard, you'll see the stats card at the top showing your progress, and you can switch between Owner/Caretaker modes to test how the app tracks who's completing activities! üê∂‚ú®","textMode":"visible_message"}
{"text":"Explain to me the rationale for why some parts of the routine is shown as orange and some parts are shown in white. "}

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building an iOS app called "PupPlan" for new puppy owners that uses AI to establish routines and helps families monitor their puppy's habits and progress. The app has two user types: primary owners (who are admins with full permissions) and caretakers (who can only contribute to caregiving but can't change settings). The primary owner flow includes: 1) Apple Sign-In authentication on a welcome screen, 2) a 4-step onboarding questionnaire about their puppy (name, breed, age, living situation, and schedule), 3) AI routine generation with animated loading, 4) a celebration reveal screen, and 5) the main dashboard showing the puppy's daily routine. I've redesigned the entire app with a premium, warm iOS aesthetic using a warm color palette (#FFF9F5 background, #E8722A primary orange, #4A9B7F sage green), proper mobile constraints (390px wide with iOS safe areas), improved typography (SF Pro fonts, 16px buttons with 600 weight), enhanced button states (hover effects, solid disabled colors), radio card selection states (orange tint when selected), and a dashboard with timeline view featuring category dots and a proper header with puppy emoji and settings icon.

## Current state
The app is fully functional with all features restored including the complete dashboard with activity tracking stats (showing completion rates by primary owner vs caretaker), a comprehensive settings screen with caretaker management (invite/remove caretakers), puppy profile viewing, and proper navigation between all screens. We just fixed the radio card selection bug in the onboarding questionnaire and added a user role switcher on the dashboard to test the activity tracking feature.

parts.contentJson:
{"text":"Great question! The color coding in the timeline is designed to help you quickly identify which activities need your attention:

## üé® Timeline Color System:

**üü† Orange/Warm Tint Background (#FFF3EB)**
- **When**: Activity time has passed BUT hasn't been completed yet
- **Purpose**: Visual alert that this activity is **overdue** and needs immediate attention
- **Additional indicator**: Orange left border stripe for extra emphasis
- **Example**: It's 2:00 PM and the 12:00 PM "Lunch" activity is still unchecked

**‚ö™ White Background (#FFFFFF)**
- **When**: Activity is either:
  1. **Upcoming** - scheduled for later in the day
  2. **Completed** - already marked done (shown with reduced opacity)
- **Purpose**: Normal state - either not time yet, or already handled
- **Example**: A 5:00 PM activity when it's only 3:00 PM

## Visual State Summary:

| State | Background | Opacity | Left Border | Right Icon |
|-------|-----------|---------|-------------|------------|
| **Future** | White | 100% | None | Empty circle |
| **Current/Overdue** | Orange tint | 100% | Orange stripe | Red X or Empty circle |
| **Completed** | White | 60% (dimmed) | None | Green checkmark |

## Design Rationale:

The orange highlight creates a **"now list"** - drawing your eye immediately to activities that should have already been done. This helps busy puppy parents prioritize their tasks at a glance without checking every timestamp. The warm orange color is intentionally less aggressive than red (which would feel stressful) but still attention-grabbing enough to be actionable.","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"
Update the Dashboard screen for PupPlan (mobile app, 375px width):

**Today's Progress Card (top of Dashboard):**
- Remove the "Logged in as Owner" button/badge completely
- Keep the unified counter showing "0/17" (large, bold numerals)
- Keep the circular percentage indicator on the right showing "0%" 
- The card should only display: "Today's Progress" heading, the counter "0/17" on the left, and the percentage circle on the right
- Adjust card height/padding to accommodate the removed element - should feel spacious but not empty

**Task Timeline - Profile Picture Attribution:**
For each task item in the timeline, update the layout to: Time ‚Üí Profile Picture ‚Üí Task Name ‚Üí Checkbox

- Completed tasks (like "7:00 AM Breakfast") should show a 24px circular profile picture avatar between the time and task name
- The avatar should have a 2px white border and subtle shadow for definition
- Use a realistic profile photo (like a person's headshot) for the avatar
- Uncompleted tasks show NO profile picture - just Time ‚Üí Task Name ‚Üí Checkbox
- The profile picture should be vertically centered with the task name
- Add 8px gap between time and profile picture, and 8px gap between profile picture and task name

Show 2-3 completed tasks with profile pictures (different people) and 3-4 uncompleted tasks without pictures to demonstrate the pattern.

**Visual consistency:** Maintain the warm, approachable color palette and mobile-first design. Profile pictures provide info but shouldn't dominate - they're secondary visual elements."}

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building an iOS app called "PupPlan" for new puppy owners that uses AI to establish routines and helps families monitor their puppy's habits and progress. The app has two user types: primary owners (who are admins with full permissions) and caretakers (who can only contribute to caregiving but can't change settings). The primary owner flow includes: 1) Google Sign-In authentication on a welcome screen, 2) a 4-step onboarding questionnaire about their puppy (name, breed, age, living situation, and schedule), 3) AI routine generation with animated loading, 4) a celebration reveal screen, and 5) the main dashboard showing the puppy's daily routine. I've designed the entire app with a premium, warm iOS aesthetic using a warm color palette (#FFF9F5 background, #E8722A primary orange, #4A9B7F sage green), proper mobile constraints (390px wide with iOS safe areas), improved typography (SF Pro fonts, 16px buttons with 600 weight), enhanced button states, radio card selection states, and a dashboard with timeline view featuring category dots and a proper header with puppy emoji and settings icon. The timeline uses color coding where orange-tinted backgrounds indicate overdue activities that need attention, while white backgrounds show upcoming or completed activities.

## Current state
The app is fully functional with all features including the complete dashboard with activity tracking stats, comprehensive settings screen with caretaker management, puppy profile viewing, and proper navigation between all screens. We just updated the authentication flow from Apple Sign-In to Google Sign-In, replacing the black Apple button with a white Google button that follows Google's official brand guidelines while maintaining the warm iOS aesthetic throughout the rest of the app.

{"text":"Perfect! I've successfully updated the Dashboard screen with all the requested changes. Here's what was implemented:

**Today's Progress Card Updates:**
- Removed the "Logged in as Owner" button/badge and the user switcher buttons
- Kept the clean layout with just "Today's Progress" heading, "0/17" counter, and circular percentage indicator
- Adjusted padding from `p-4` to `p-5` for a more spacious feel after removing elements

**Task Timeline - Profile Picture Attribution:**
- Updated timeline layout to show: Time ‚Üí Profile Picture ‚Üí Task Name ‚Üí Checkbox
- Profile pictures (24px circular avatars) only appear for completed tasks
- Each avatar has a 2px white border and subtle drop shadow for definition
- Uses realistic profile photos from Unsplash (3 different people)
- Uncompleted tasks show no profile picture - just Time ‚Üí Task Name ‚Üí Checkbox
- Profile pictures are vertically centered and use 8px gaps (via `gap-2` which is 8px in Tailwind)
- Random avatar assignment when tasks are completed to demonstrate variety

The design maintains the warm, mobile-first aesthetic while making profile attribution a subtle, secondary visual element that provides useful information without dominating the interface.","textMode":"visible_message"}

- Completed tasks: Time ‚Üí Task Name ‚Üí Profile Picture with checkmark badge

I need to update the Dashboard component to move the profile picture to where the status icon currently is, and add a checkmark overlay on the profile picture.","signature":""}
